TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed FSharpAsyncBuilder extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The type of the async operator, used to build workflows for asynchronous computations.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<TResult> Bind<T,TResult> (Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T> computation, Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc<T,Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<TResult>> binder);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!TResult> Bind<T, TResult>(class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T> computation, class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc`2<!!T, class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!TResult>> binder) cil managed
Public Function Bind(Of T, TResult) (computation As FSharpAsync(Of T), binder As FSharpFunc(Of T, FSharpAsync(Of TResult))) As FSharpAsync(Of TResult)
member this.Bind : Async<'T> * ('T -> Async<'Result>) -> Async<'Result>

Docs.param: The computation to provide an unbound result.
The function to bind the result of computation.
Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that runs computation, and when computation generates a result T, runs binder res.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that performs a monadic bind on the result of computation.
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed when the computation is executed.
The existence of this method permits the use of let! in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T> Combine<T> (Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> computation1, Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T> computation2);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T> Combine<T>(class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> computation1, class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T> computation2) cil managed
Public Function Combine(Of T) (computation1 As FSharpAsync(Of Unit), computation2 As FSharpAsync(Of T)) As FSharpAsync(Of T)
member this.Combine : Async<unit> * Async<'T> -> Async<'T>

Docs.param: The first part of the sequenced computation.
The second part of the sequenced computation.
Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that first runs computation1 and then runs computation2, returning the result of computation2.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that runs both of the computations sequentially.
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed when the computation is executed.
The existence of this method permits the use of expression sequencing in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

Public Function Delay(Of T) (generator As FSharpFunc(Of Unit, FSharpAsync(Of T))) As FSharpAsync(Of T)
member this.Delay : (unit -> Async<'T>) -> Async<'T>

Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that runs generator.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that runs generator.
Docs.remarks: A cancellation check is performed when the computation is executed.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> For<T> (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> sequence, Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc<T,Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit>> body);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> For<T>(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<!!T> sequence, class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc`2<!!T, class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit>> body) cil managed
Public Function For(Of T) (sequence As IEnumerable(Of T), body As FSharpFunc(Of T, FSharpAsync(Of Unit))) As FSharpAsync(Of Unit)
member this.For : seq<'T> * ('T -> Async<unit>) -> Async<unit>

Docs.param: A function to take an item from the sequence and create an asynchronous computation. Can be seen as the body of the for expression.
Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that enumerates the sequence seq on demand and runs body for each element.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that will enumerate the sequence and run body for each element.
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed on each iteration of the loop.
The existence of this method permits the use of for in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T> Return<T> (T value);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T> Return<T>(!!T value) cil managed
Public Function Return(Of T) (value As T) As FSharpAsync(Of T)
member this.Return : 'T -> Async<'T>

Docs.param: The value to return from the computation.
Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that returns the result v.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that returns value when executed.
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed when the computation is executed.
The existence of this method permits the use of return in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

member this.ReturnFrom : Async<'T> -> Async<'T>

Docs.remarks: The existence of this method permits the use of return! in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T> TryFinally<T> (Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T> computation, Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc<Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> compensation);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T> TryFinally<T>(class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T> computation, class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc`2<class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit, class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> compensation) cil managed
Public Function TryFinally(Of T) (computation As FSharpAsync(Of T), compensation As FSharpFunc(Of Unit, Unit)) As FSharpAsync(Of T)
member this.TryFinally : Async<'T> * (unit -> unit) -> Async<'T>

Docs.param: The action to be run after computation completes or raises an exception (including cancellation).
Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that runs computation. The action compensation is executed after computation completes, whether computation exits normally or by an exception. If compensation raises an exception itself the original exception is discarded and the new exception becomes the overall result of the computation.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that executes computation and compensation afterwards or when an exception is raised.
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed when the computation is executed.
The existence of this method permits the use of try/finally in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T> TryWith<T> (Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T> computation, Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc<Exception,Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<T>> catchHandler);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T> TryWith<T>(class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T> computation, class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc`2<class System.Exception, class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!T>> catchHandler) cil managed
Public Function TryWith(Of T) (computation As FSharpAsync(Of T), catchHandler As FSharpFunc(Of Exception, FSharpAsync(Of T))) As FSharpAsync(Of T)
member this.TryWith : Async<'T> * (Exception -> Async<'T>) -> Async<'T>

Docs.param: The function to run when computation throws an exception.
Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that runs computation and returns its result. If an exception happens then catchHandler(exn) is called and the resulting computation executed instead.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that executes computation and calls catchHandler if an exception is thrown.
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed when the computation is executed.
The existence of this method permits the use of try/with in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<TResult> Using<T,TResult> (T resource, Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc<T,Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<TResult>> binder) where T : IDisposable;

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!TResult> Using<(class System.IDisposable) T, TResult>(!!T resource, class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc`2<!!T, class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<!!TResult>> binder) cil managed
Public Function Using(Of T As IDisposable, TResult As IDisposable) (resource As T, binder As FSharpFunc(Of T, FSharpAsync(Of TResult))) As FSharpAsync(Of TResult)
member this.Using : 'T * ('T -> Async<'Result> (requires 'T :> IDisposable)) -> Async<'Result> (requires 'T :> IDisposable)

Docs.param: The resource to be used and disposed.
The function that takes the resource and returns an asynchronous computation.
Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that runs binder(resource). The action resource.Dispose() is executed as this computation yields its result or if the asynchronous computation exits by an exception or by cancellation.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that binds and eventually disposes resource.
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed when the computation is executed.
The existence of this method permits the use of use and use! in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> While (Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc<Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,bool> guard, Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> computation);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> While(class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc`2<class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit, bool> guard, class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> computation) cil managed
Public Function While (guard As FSharpFunc(Of Unit, Boolean), computation As FSharpAsync(Of Unit)) As FSharpAsync(Of Unit)
member this.While : (unit -> bool) * Async<unit> -> Async<unit>

Docs.param: The function to determine when to stop executing computation.
The function to be executed. Equivalent to the body of a while expression.
Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that runs computation repeatedly until guard() becomes false.
Docs.returns: An asynchronous computation that behaves similarly to a while loop when run.
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed whenever the computation is executed.
The existence of this method permits the use of while in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync<Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> Zero ();
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.FSharp.Control.FSharpAsync`1<class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit> Zero() cil managed
Public Function Zero () As FSharpAsync(Of Unit)
member this.Zero : unit -> Async<unit>

Docs.summary: Creates an asynchronous computation that just returns ().
Docs.remarks:
A cancellation check is performed when the computation is executed.
The existence of this method permits the use of empty else branches in the async { ... } computation expression syntax.
